title: `print!` does not work after shutdown if no previous print occurred

labels.name: T-libs
labels.description: Relevant to the library team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
fn main() {
    extern "C" fn bye() {
        print!("hello, world!");
    }
    unsafe { libc::atexit(bye) };
}
```

#### I expected to see this happen:
The code should print "hello, world!", which it does if any `print` statement occurred before it (see the [test](`src/test/ui/runtime/stdout-during-shutdown.rs`)).

#### Instead, this happened:
Nothing is printed to standard output.

The bug is in the cleanup function that disables buffering during shutdown:
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/92086258e30ae59610a1b1097d97227377db0ada/library/std/src/io/stdio.rs#L613-L625
If the buffer has not been initialized yet, that will not occur, so the `print` statement will initialize the buffer in the normal fashion and it will not be flushed.
